titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Christine Borne, Project Archivist; James A. Kohler, Project Archivist

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-10-08T17:11-0400

physdesc.extent: (4 records cartons, 1 Hollinger box, 1 flat box, 114 audiovisual boxes, 7 binders, 1 shared flat file drawer)

did.abstract: The Herb Staehr Collection spans the years circa 1950 to 2007, with the bulk of the material dating between 1968 and 2007. It comprises 138 linear feet of material mainly related to Alvin Lee, Ten Years After, and Eric Clapton, but also to a variety of artists active during the mid-1960s to mid-2000s. Staehr, author of Alvin Lee & Ten Years After: Visual History, was the preeminent collector of Alvin Lee and Ten Years After memorabilia. The bulk of the collection consists of bootleg concert recordings, with some papers, scrapbooks, and photographic material. The collection is divided into seven series: papers, scrapbooks, photographs, slides, negatives, concert recordings, and contact sheets. The collection will be valuable to researchers interested in the history of Ten Years After, English blues-rock, and Woodstock, as well to those looking for images of Eric Clapton or Alvin Lee, and viewing or listening to performances that have not been commercially released.
did.langmaterial: Collection is primarily in English; materials in French, German, Dutch, Italian, Danish, Japanese, and Swedish can be found in clippings in Series I and Series II and in video from Series VI. Languages other than English are noted at the Subseries and item level.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

chronitem.event: Attends the Woodstock Festival, where he first hears Ten Years After.
Publishes Alvin Lee and Ten Years After: A Visual History.

bioghist.p: Herb Staehr was a collector of photographs and memorabilia related to the English blues-rock band Ten Years After, who performed at Woodstock in 1969. He was the author of Alvin Lee and Ten Years After: A Visual History, regarded as the definitive work on the band.

list.head: Sources
list.item: "Tribute to Herb Staehr -- Historian of the Band Ten Years After." Ten Years After. Accessed May 13, 2011. http://www.ten-years-after.com/herb/tribute.htm.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Patrons must sign the Acknowledgment of Legal Responsibility and Privacy Rights statement on the Researcher Registration form before using this collection. The condition of some of these materials has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Some of the audiovisual materials in the collection are on defunct media formats and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: The Herb Staehr Collection was received by the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Inc. as a gift from Thomas W. and Claudia Staehr on December 8, 2008.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Inc. has a limited copyright license to the materials within this collection. The transfer of Donor's literary and other property rights does not include works of other individuals and organizations contained in the gift. For more information, please consult the staff of the Library and Archives.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Christine Borne, Project Archivist, and James A. Kohler, Project Archivist. Completed July 27, 2012. Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS and local processing manual.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Commercially released CDs, videocassettes, and audiocassettes have been transferred to the library collection. Please search for the "Herb Staehr Collection" in the library catalog for a list of donated titles. If you are unable to find what you are looking for, consult the Library and Archives staff to ensure these materials are available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I: Papers, which spans circa 1970s to 2007 and includes some undated material, is arranged alphabetically by subject. It mainly consists of Staehr’s correspondence and drafts of his book, Alvin Lee and Ten Years After: A Visual History. Clippings come primarily from, but are not limited to, the Dutch music magazine Muziek Express and contain photographs and some music reviews. The video and audio inventories listed at the end of the series likely correspond to the audiovisuals in the collection.

did.langmaterial: Some of the materials in this file are in Dutch, German and Italian.
Collection is primarily in English; materials in Dutch, French, German, and Japanese are indicated at the file level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II: Scrapbooks spans the years circa 1950 to 2006 and contains the contents of scrapbooks collected by Herb Staehr. All of these materials, now housed in acid-free folders, were originally stored in 3-inch binders. Original order was maintained. The scrapbook materials consist of photographs, clippings, concert tickets, and other documents. The scrapbooks are arranged first by subject matter and then in rough chronological order; many of the scrapbooks represent a broad range of years. Most of the scrapbooks are general collections of ephemera and memorabilia related to Alvin Lee and Ten Years After; there are also a few items related to Eric Clapton, the Yardbirds, and Cream. Of particular interest is one childhood photo of Alvin Lee, taken circa 1950.

did.unittitle: Alvin Lee and the Alvin Lee Band

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III: Photographs spans the years circa 1960s-2000 and consists primarily of images of Alvin Lee and Ten Years After, but also includes a large selection of images of Eric Clapton--with Blind Faith, Cream, solo, and one photo with Muddy Waters and Johnny Winter. In some cases, photographers are attributed. All of these materials were originally collected and stored in 3-inch binders. Original order was maintained where possible.

did.unittitle: Lee, Alvin, Jayhawks, Ten Years After
Blind Faith, Eric Clapton, and Cream

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Artists featured in this file include Duane Allman, The Beatles, Jeff Beck, Chuck Berry, Tommy Bolin, Doobie Brothers, Faces, Buddy Guy, Jefferson Airplane, Led Zeppelin, Lynyrd Skynyrd, The Rolling Stones, Linda Ronstadt, Bruce Springsteen, Rod Stewart, Jimmie Vaughan, Stevie Ray Vaughan, The Who, and The Yardbirds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV: Slides spans the years circa 1968 to 2000 and consists of archival binders of mylar pages holding slides. The images represented here are mostly of Alvin Lee and Ten Years After performances, but also include concert images of Chuck Berry, Blind Faith, Eric Clapton, Judy Collins, Cream, Bob Dylan, John Fogerty, Janis Joplin, B.B. King, Gladys Knight and the Pips, Moody Blues, Rolling Stones, Linda Ronstadt, Santana, and Tina Turner, as well as images of concert posters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V: Negatives spans the years circa 1968 to 2000 and consists primarily of live concert images of Alvin Lee and Ten Years After, but also includes images of performances by Blind Faith, Eric Clapton, Cream, Jimi Hendrix, Led Zeppelin, Muddy Waters, Stevie Ray Vaughan, and Johnny Winter, as well as images of concert posters.

did.unittitle: Series VI: Concert, Studio, and Television Recordings [RESTRICTED]
did.langmaterial: Collection is primarily in English; materials in Danish, German, Japanese, Norwegian, and Swedish are indicated at the subseries level and, in subseries 2, at the item level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VI: Concert, Studio, and Television Recordings spans the years circa 1960s to 2000s and comprises nearly a third of the entire Herb Staehr Collection. The Series consists of seven subseries, each of which corresponds to a particular audio or video format: CD, audiocassette, DVD, Beta, VHS, film, and minidisc. Most of the recordings are of Alvin Lee, Ten Years After, Eric Clapton, and Cream. Subseries 1, 2, 6, and 7 include item-level inventories. For researchers interested in the materials in Subseries 3-5, please contact Library and Archives staff for additional information.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The condition of some of these materials has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Some of the audiovisual materials in the collection are on defunct media formats and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 1: Compact Discs, circa 1960s-2000s are organized alphabetically by performer. In instances where there is more than one CD for a performer or group, the CDs have been arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 2: DVD-Video, circa 1960s-2000s, are organized alphabetically by performer. In instances where there is more than one DVD for a performer or group, the DVDs have been arranged chronologically. Award ceremonies, documentaries, music festivals, television series and specials, and compilations of footage will be found under "Various" in alphabetical order by program title or event; then chronologically where necessary. Please note, the order in which the DVDs appear in the finding aid is not always the same as the physical order of the materials, as some discs contain multiple artists and/or events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The items in Subseries 2: Audiocassettes are in their original order as received from the donor and consist of 1,305 audiocassettes. Content for Eric Clapton, Alvin Lee, and Ten Years After comprise the bulk of the Subseries, while a significant number of audiocassettes are also devoted to Jimi Hendrix, Led Zeppelin, and The Rolling Stones. Other performers represented in the Subseries include Aerosmith, Jan Ackerman, Allman Brothers, Animals, Atlanta Rhythm Section, Bad Company, Badfinger, Band, Ginger Baker, Beatles, Beck, Bogart, and Appice, Jeff Beck, Pat Benatar, Chuck Berry, Big Brother and the Holding Company, Elvin Bishop, Blind Faith, Jack Bruce, Roy Buchanan, Paul Butterfield, Byrds, J.J. Cale, Canned Heat, Joe Cocker, Phil Collins, Robert Cray, Cream, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Crosby, Stills, Nash, and Young, Deep Purple, Delaney and Bonnie, Derek and the Dominos, Dire Straits, Doors, Bob Dylan, Eagles, Faces, Firm, Fleetwood Mac, John Fogerty, Foghat, Foreigner, Peter Frampton, Free, Rory Gallagher, Grand Funk Railroad, Peter Green, Buddy Guy, George Harrison, Jeff Healey, Heart, Hot Tuna, Humble Pie, Jefferson Airplane, Jethro Tull, Katrina and the Waves, Greg Kihn, Albert King, B.B. King, Freddie King, Kinks, Leo Kottke, Little Feat, Lynyrd Skynyrd, Mamas and the Papas, Mahavishnu Orchestra, Steve Marriott, Dave Mason, John Mayall, John McLaughlin, Melanie, Moody Blues, Gary Moore, Jim Morrison, Muddy Waters, Note For Note, Robert Palmer, Jimmy Page and Robert Plant, Pink Floyd, Procol Harum, Linda Rondstadt, Santana, Savoy Brown, Steely Dan, Steppenwolf, Cat Stevens, Stephen Stills, Mick Taylor, Ten Years Later, Thin Lizzy, Robin Tower, Traffic, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Gene Vincent, Junior Wells, Roger Waters, Who, Edgar Winter, Johnny Winter, Steve Winwood, Wishbone Ash, Yardbirds, and Neil Young.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The condition of these materials has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

did.langmaterial: Collection is primarily in English. Some of the video was featured on international television networks; therefore, it may contain material in German and Japanese. Material in languages other than English are noted at the item level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items in Subseries 5: VHS Videocassettes are in their original order as received from the donor and consist of 960 VHS videocassettes. Content on Eric Clapton, Alvin Lee, and Ten Years After comprise the bulk of the Subseries, which also includes footage from television programs and festivals. Other performers represented in the Subseries include AC/DC, Aerosmith, Allman Brothers, Animals, Bad Company , Randy Bachman, Ginger Baker, Band, Bangles, Beatles, Jeff Beck, Bee Gees, Pat Benatar, Blondie, Byrds, Jack Bruce, Eric Burden, Joe Cocker, Cream, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Jim Croce, Crosby, Stills, Nash, and Young, Burton Cummings, Deep Purple, Doors, Bob Dylan, Eagles, Faces, Fleetwood Mac, John Fogerty, Foghat, Peter Frampton, Rory Gallagher, Guess Who, Buddy Guy, George Harrison, Richie Havens, Jeff Healey, Heart, Jimi Hendrix, J. Geils Band, Jefferson Airplane, Joan Jett, Jethro Tull, Elton John, Janis Joplin, B.B. King, Freddie King, Kinks, Al Kooper, Led Zeppelin, John Lennon, Little Feat, Lone Justice, Los Lobos, Lynyrd Skynayrd, Dave Mason, John Mayall, Paul McCartney, Roger McGuinn, Joni Mitchell, Moody Blues, Gary Moore, Van Morrison, Moutain, Muddy Waters, Stevie Nicks, Notting Hillibillies, Jimmy Page, Tom Petty, Pink Floyd, Plastic Ono Band, Police, Pretenders, Rainbow, Bonnie Raitt, Rolling Stones, Linda Rondstadt, Santana, Savoy Brown, Dusty Springfield, Ringo Starr, Mick Taylor, Robin Trower, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Pete Townshend, Tina Turner, Joe Walsh, Roger Waters, Who, Johnny Winter, Steve Winwood, Yardbirds, Yes, Neil Young, Frank Zappa, Zucchero, and ZZ Top. Television programs and festivals featured in the Subseries include American Bandstand, Beat Club, Beat! Beat! Beat!, California Jam, California Screamin’, Colour Me Pop, Dick Cavett Show, Don Kirshner’s Rock Concert, Ed Sullivan Show, How It Is, Isle of Wight Pop Festival, Johnny Cash Show, Live From the Bitter End, Midnight Special, Old Grey Whistle Test, Ready, Steady, Go!, Shindig, Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour, Top of the Pops, Woodstock, and Woodstock ‘94.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The condition of these materials has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

did.langmaterial: Collection is primarily in English. Some of the video was featured on international television networks; therefore, it may contain material in German and Japanese. Materials in languages other than English are noted a the item level.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The audiovisual material in this subseries is on a defunct media format and, therefore, is RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials will have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The audiovisual material in this subseries is on a defunct media format and, therefore, is RESTRICTED. An access copy of this material will have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to this material is available.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The audiovisual material in this series is on a defunct media format and, therefore, is RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials will have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 7: MiniDiscs consists of two MiniDiscs, one sent to Herb Staehr by Luky Schrempf.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VII: Contact Sheets spans the years 1968 to 1977 and 2002, and includes some undated material. The Series consists of one folder of contact sheets, correspondence, and notes from the photographers' whose work is featured, and a magazine article related to the New Yardbirds' (Led Zeppelin) first concert. The contact sheets contain photographs of Blind Faith, Eric Clapton, Jimi Hendrix, Jeff Beck Group, Led Zeppelin, The New Yardbirds, Ten Years After, Johnny Winter, and The Yardbirds. Credited photographers: Jørgen Angel, DAGMAR, and Steen Møller Rasmussen.
